prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. It has four faces, each with a loop consisting of four lines. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3333, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with the following sketch: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5833] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.5833] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Use a scaling parameter of 0.75 to scale the 2D sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.3333 towards the normal to create the 3D model. **Part 2: Cut a cylindrical hole in the center of the prism** The second part is a cylindrical hole that is cut into the center of the prism. It has one face with a loop consisting of one circle. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1667, 0.0, 0.1667] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with the following sketch: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Circle 1: Center [0.1667, 0.1667], Radius 0.1667 Use a scaling parameter of 0.3333 to scale the 2D sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Cut the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.3333 opposite the normal to create the cylindrical hole. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.3333 units - Height: 0.3333 units.</description>
